intro: Polygonum agreste, commonly known as common smartweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with reddish veins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or red, followed by three-lobed seed capsules. It thrives in moist soils along stream banks, roadsides, and disturbed areas. Polygonum agreste is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
